perturbation.original_text:
Further, Supplier shall at
a minimum retain [* * *].
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier shall maintain insurance as it deems appropriate.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates a minimum insurance coverage, which protects the customer against potential liabilities. Removing this minimum requirement and giving the supplier discretion violates general principles requiring adequate insurance coverage to protect against foreseeable risks, which many jurisdiction mandates.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles, specific jurisdiction insurance regulations

perturbation.original_text:
In no event shall Customer seek to recover a refund for, or replacement to, an Out of Specification Product due to Supplier’s breach of Sections 13.1
(f), (g) or (h) except pursuant to Article 8.
perturbation.changed_text: Customer’s sole recourse for Out of Specification Product is limited to Supplier’s discretion.
perturbation.explanation: This eliminates the customer's right to refunds or replacements for defective products due to supplier breaches, which are legally protected rights. It allows the supplier complete control over remedies for its failures, which may violate basic principles of fair trade and consumer protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer Protection Laws, Uniform Commercial Code

perturbation.original_text:
Each Party agrees that the other Party may be irreparably damaged if any provision of this Agreement is not performed in accordance with its terms.
Accordingly, notwithstanding Section 19.3, each Party will be entitled to apply for an injunction or injunctions to prevent breaches of any of the
provisions of this Agreement by the other Party, without showing or proving any actual or threatened damage, notwithstanding any rule of law or
equity to the contrary, and may specifically enforce such provisions by an action instituted in a court having jurisdiction. These specific remedies
are in addition to any other remedy to which the Parties may be entitled at law or in equity.
perturbation.changed_text: Neither party shall be entitled to injunctive relief for any breach of this agreement; remedies are limited to monetary damages.
perturbation.explanation: Denying injunctive relief restricts the ability to prevent ongoing harm, potentially violating legal requirements that support equitable remedies when monetary compensation is insufficient. This undermines the principle that specific performance can be mandated where damages are inadequate.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law principles related to equitable remedies and specific performance
